benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/catalog/xml - Retrieve the full catalog as XML

covered: Valid Request: TC01-TC04 cover successful retrieval of latest, by requestedDate, by accountId, and both; assert 200, text/xml, and valid XML.
Empty Response: TC05 (no catalog -> 4xx) and TC15 (empty catalog -> 200 with empty structure) validate empty/absent data handling.
Query Parameters: TC02-TC04 (valid combos), TC07-TC08 (invalid formats), TC09 (unsupported params ignored) exercise parameter handling.
Authorization: TC10 (401) and TC11 (403) verify unauthorized/forbidden access.
Security/Validation: TC13 (injection) and TC16 (max lengths) cover input hardening.
Resilience and failure handling: TC12 (503), TC14 (retry), TC22 (504) cover service/downstream failures and timeouts.
Performance/Scalability: TC17 (very large catalog), TC18 (concurrency), TC21 (peak load) exercise non-functional behavior.
Schema/Compatibility: TC19 (well-formed XML) and TC20 (backward compatibility) check output correctness.
Pagination: Not applicable to this endpoint; large-data handling is addressed by TC17.
gaps: Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control, conditional GET (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since), or 304 Not Modified.
Rate Limiting: No scenarios validating 429 Too Many Requests and Retry-After under burst traffic.
Ambiguous assertions: Several tests expect "404 or 400"; exact status codes per condition are not specified.
Unknown but valid accountId: No test where a syntactically valid UUID does not map to any account or catalog, and expected status is verified.
Content negotiation: No tests for Accept header behavior (e.g., 406 when client does not accept text/xml) or charset/encoding details.
Date/time edges: No scenarios for timezone offsets/Z suffix, DST boundaries, leap seconds, or timestamps exactly at version effective boundaries.
recommendations: Add caching tests: capture ETag and Last-Modified on 200 responses; repeat with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since to validate 304; verify Cache-Control and Vary (accountId, requestedDate).
Add rate limiting tests: generate burst traffic to trigger 429 and assert Retry-After; verify recovery after the window.
Make error codes deterministic: replace "404 or 400" with a single expected code per case (e.g., 404 for not found, 400 for invalid input) and align with API contract.
Add valid-but-missing resource cases: use a valid but non-existent accountId (with and without requestedDate) and assert the correct status and error body.
Add content negotiation checks: Accept: text/xml -> 200; Accept: application/json only -> 406; no Accept -> default; assert XML charset (UTF-8) and XML declaration.
Add date boundary tests: requestedDate exactly at a version's effective instant and 1 ms before/after; cover different timezone offsets (Z, +00:00, -05:00) and extreme future/past dates.
Optional: If supported, add HEAD request behavior for headers-only; otherwise confirm GET ignores any request body.
